title: 010 Fetch AudioMP3 files from specific folder of device or fetch all files
First, add the following permissions to the manifest of your project in order to enable device storage access:

inline_content.Text: First, add the following permissions to the manifest of your project in order to enable device storage access:

title:
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
Then, create the file
AudioModel.class
i
and put the following model class into it in order to allow getting and setting list items:

inline_content.Text: and put the following model class into it in order to allow getting and setting list items:

title: Next, use the following method to read all MP3 files from a folder of your device or to read all files of your device:

inline_content.Text: Next, use the following method to read all MP3 files from a folder of your device or to read all files of your device:

title: The code above will return a list of all MP3 files with the music’s name, path, artist, and album. For more details please refer to the
Media.Store.Audio
a
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/MediaStore.Audio.html
documentation.

inline_content.Text: The code above will return a list of all MP3 files with the music’s name, path, artist, and album. For more details please refer to the

title: In order to read files of a specific folder, use the following query (you need to replace the folder name):

inline_content.Text: In order to read files of a specific folder, use the following query (you need to replace the folder name):

title:
Cursor c = context.getContentResolver().query(uri,
    projection,
    MediaStore.Audio.Media.DATA + " like ? ",
    new String[]{"%yourFolderName%"}, // Put your device folder / file location here.
    null);

content_resolved.code:
Cursor c = context.getContentResolver().query(uri,
    projection,
    MediaStore.Audio.Media.DATA + " like ? ",
    new String[]{"%yourFolderName%"}, // Put your device folder / file location here.
    null);

title: If you want to retrieve all files from your device, then use the following query:

inline_content.Text: If you want to retrieve all files from your device, then use the following query:

title:
Cursor c = context.getContentResolver().query(uri,
    projection,
    null,
    null,
    null);

content_resolved.code:
Cursor c = context.getContentResolver().query(uri,
    projection,
    null,
    null,
    null);

title: Note: Don’t forget to enable storage access permissions.

inline_content.Text: Note: Don’t forget to enable storage access permissions.

title: Now, all you have to do is to call the method above in order to get the MP3 files:

inline_content.Text: Now, all you have to do is to call the method above in order to get the MP3 files:

title: getAllAudioFromDevice(this);
